source_references: Journal of Thoracic and Cardiovascular Surgery

content.title: Frozen Elephant Trunk (FET) Procedure
content.definition: A hybrid surgical technique combining conventional elephant trunk (open arch replacement) with antegrade deployment of a stent graft into the descending thoracic aorta, allowing single-stage treatment of extensive thoracic aortic pathology.

concept.traditional_elephant_trunk: Free-floating graft in descending aorta for later completion
concept.frozen_elephant_trunk: Stent graft fixed in descending aorta - single-stage option

primary: Type A dissection extending into descending aorta
Type B dissection with arch involvement
Chronic dissection with arch and descending disease
additional: Marfan syndrome with extensive aortic disease

relative: Prior descending aortic surgery limiting stent landing

approach.cannulation: Central or peripheral arterial, right atrial venous

circulatory_management.cerebral_protection: Unilateral or bilateral antegrade cerebral perfusion

procedural_steps: Establish cardiopulmonary bypass and cool patient
Arrest circulation when target temperature reached
Open arch and identify branch vessels
Deploy FET stent graft antegradely into descending aorta
Complete arch replacement (reimplant branches or island)
Anastomose arch graft to FET graft proximally

fet_device_deployment.orientation: Stent graft inserted from open arch, deployed antegradely
fet_device_deployment.positioning: Distal landing zone confirmed by angiography or palpation
fet_device_deployment.proximal_cuff: Dacron collar sewn to arch replacement graft

arch_reconstruction_options.hybrid_debranching: Debranching followed by FET in select cases

spinal_cord_ischemia.prevention: Limit FET length, spinal drainage, staged approach

over_classical_elephant_trunk: Promotes false lumen thrombosis in dissection

limitations: Higher SCI risk if long stent graft used

codes.cpt: 33877 | Repair of thoracoabdominal aneurysm with graft

content.statement: Frozen Elephant Trunk (FET) Procedure is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Procedures Frozen-Elephant-Trunk that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Frozen Elephant Trunk (FET) Procedure helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Frozen Elephant Trunk (FET) Procedure include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Frozen Elephant Trunk (FET) Procedure.

clinical_pearls: FET = single-stage hybrid solution for arch + descending aortic disease
Combines open arch replacement with antegrade stent graft deployment
In dissection, promotes false lumen thrombosis and aortic remodeling
Spinal cord ischemia risk 5-10% - limit FET length, use spinal drainage
Most common indication = Type A dissection extending into descending aorta
learning_objectives: Understand the frozen elephant trunk concept vs classical elephant trunk
board_review_points: FET = arch replacement + antegrade descending stent graft
Single-stage treatment of arch + descending disease
Requires circulatory arrest with cerebral perfusion
Promotes false lumen thrombosis in dissection

citations.source: UpToDate. (2024). Frozen Elephant Trunk (FET) Procedure. Wolters Kluwer.
Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.
